sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_tool_86cc9787831432107f448287ceda1e19
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Lookup ITIL Use</description><input_schema>[{"name":"crudInputs","description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</input_schema><name>Lookup ITIL Use</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    // only string inputs are allowed 
    // return outputs object where the keys in it are understandable by LLM    
    // lookup script

    // parses expression containing {{variables}}
    function parseQuery(expression, inputs) {
        if (!expression) return "";
        return expression.replace(/{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g, function(match, variableName) {
            if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                return inputs[variableName];
            }
            return "";
        });

    }

    function getTypedValue(gr, table, field) {
        var fieldValue = gr.getValue(field.id);
        if (field.type === "choice") {
            var choiceGR = new GlideRecordSecure("sys_choice");
            choiceGR.addQuery("name", table);
            choiceGR.addQuery("element", field.id);
            choiceGR.addQuery("value", fieldValue);
            choiceGR.query();
            if (choiceGR.next()) {
                return choiceGR.getValue('label');
            }
        } else if (field.referenceTable) {
            var refName = field.referenceTableDefaultField;
            var refGR = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGR.addQuery("sys_id", fieldValue);
            refGR.query();
            if (refName && refGR.next()) {
                return refGR.getValue(refName);
            }
        }
        return fieldValue;
    }

    var table = inputs.crudInputs.table.value;
    var tableName = inputs.crudInputs.table.displayValue;
    var query = parseQuery(inputs.crudInputs.query, inputs);
    var sortType = inputs.crudInputs.sortType;
    var orderBy = inputs.crudInputs.orderBy;
    var limit = inputs.crudInputs.limit || 5;
    var fields = inputs.crudInputs.returnFields || [];

    var results = [];
    var protectedRecords = 0;
    var gr = new GlideRecordSecure(table);
    if (query) {
        gr.addEncodedQuery(query);
    }
    if (orderBy && sortType === 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderBy(orderBy);
    } else if (orderBy && sortType !== 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderByDesc(orderBy);
    }

    gr.setLimit(limit);
    gr.query();
    while (gr.next()) {
        var fieldObj = {};
        if (gr.canRead()) {
            fields.forEach(function(field) {
                if (gr.canRead(field.id)) {
                    fieldObj[field.id] = getTypedValue(gr, table, field);
                } else {
                    // number of fields that cannot be read for each record
                    if (fieldObj["protectedFields"] >= 1) {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"]++;
                    } else {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"] = 1;
                    }
                }
            });
        } else {
            protectedRecords++;
        }
        results.push(fieldObj);
    }
    var recordCount = results.length;
    var total = recordCount + protectedRecords;
    var message = gs.getMessage("{0} out of {1} records returned from the {2} table.",
        [recordCount.toString(), total.toString(), tableName]);

    return {
        "records": results,
        "message": message,
        "status": "success"
    };
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-05 03:03:13</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>86cc9787831432107f448287ceda1e19</sys_id><sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Lookup ITIL Use</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_86cc9787831432107f448287ceda1e19</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 03:03:13</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table>sn_aia_tool</target_document_table><type>crud</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Analyze financial impact of delivery disruptions and create incident tracking</description><instructions>You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creation.
Set agent variable delivery_delay_sys_id = sys_id from the Delivery Delay lookup. Set agent variable incident_sys_id = sys_id of the newly created Incident.
Do the following:
1) Query the Delivery Delay record using route_id. 2) Query the Supply Agreement record using customer_id. 3) Compute an agent variable named impact_json: - Parse proposed_routes (JSON array) from the Delivery Delay record. - For each route: hours = eta_minutes / 60 (and round up the answer to the next whole integer) delay_hours = max(hours - deliver_window_hours, 0) penalty = delay_hours * stockout_penalty_rate - Build this JSON object: { "customer_id": <int>, "deliver_window_hours": <int>, "stockout_penalty_rate": <int>, "routes": [ { "option_id": "...", "route_number": ..., "eta_minutes": ...,"delay_hours": ..., "penalty": ... } ] } - Set impact_json to the stringified JSON above.
4) Create an Incident summarizing the problem and penalties.
AT THE END IMPORTANT! 5) Update the Delivery Delay record (matching by delivery_delay_sys_id) with: Place impact_json into the calculated_impact field - incident_sys_id = incident_sys_id - status = "calculated"</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Financial Analysis Agent</internal_name><name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in financial analysis and incident record creation, enabling them to calculate delay costs for proposed route options, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger the next agent. - The agent follows a detailed ACTION PLAN that includes querying records, computing impact variables, creating incidents, and updating records, ensuring a systematic approach to task execution. - The agent uses the 'Create Incident' tool to generate incident records for delivery delays, incorporating inputs such as route_id, truck_id, problem_description, and impact_json to ensure comprehensive documentation. - The agent utilizes TOOL inputs like route_id and truck_id to accurately identify and document delivery delay scenarios, ensuring precise incident record creation. - The agent employs CRUD Input Variables to automate the creation of incident records, ensuring efficiency and consistency in documenting delivery delays. - The agent combines TOOLS to calculate penalties, create incidents, and update records, ensuring a holistic approach to managing delivery delays and progressing workflows.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creator. Your role will be to calculate delay costs for each proposed route option, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger next agent.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-27 01:57:37</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03</sys_id><sys_mod_count>126</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 02:33:13</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Lookup ITIL User</description><input_schema>[{"name":"crudInputs","description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</input_schema><name>Lookup ITIL User</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    // only string inputs are allowed 
    // return outputs object where the keys in it are understandable by LLM    
    // lookup script

    // parses expression containing {{variables}}
    function parseQuery(expression, inputs) {
        if (!expression) return "";
        return expression.replace(/{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g, function(match, variableName) {
            if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                return inputs[variableName];
            }
            return "";
        });

    }

    function getTypedValue(gr, table, field) {
        var fieldValue = gr.getValue(field.id);
        if (field.type === "choice") {
            var choiceGR = new GlideRecordSecure("sys_choice");
            choiceGR.addQuery("name", table);
            choiceGR.addQuery("element", field.id);
            choiceGR.addQuery("value", fieldValue);
            choiceGR.query();
            if (choiceGR.next()) {
                return choiceGR.getValue('label');
            }
        } else if (field.referenceTable) {
            var refName = field.referenceTableDefaultField;
            var refGR = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGR.addQuery("sys_id", fieldValue);
            refGR.query();
            if (refName && refGR.next()) {
                return refGR.getValue(refName);
            }
        }
        return fieldValue;
    }

    var table = inputs.crudInputs.table.value;
    var tableName = inputs.crudInputs.table.displayValue;
    var query = parseQuery(inputs.crudInputs.query, inputs);
    var sortType = inputs.crudInputs.sortType;
    var orderBy = inputs.crudInputs.orderBy;
    var limit = inputs.crudInputs.limit || 5;
    var fields = inputs.crudInputs.returnFields || [];

    var results = [];
    var protectedRecords = 0;
    var gr = new GlideRecordSecure(table);
    if (query) {
        gr.addEncodedQuery(query);
    }
    if (orderBy && sortType === 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderBy(orderBy);
    } else if (orderBy && sortType !== 'a_to_z') {
        gr.orderByDesc(orderBy);
    }

    gr.setLimit(limit);
    gr.query();
    while (gr.next()) {
        var fieldObj = {};
        if (gr.canRead()) {
            fields.forEach(function(field) {
                if (gr.canRead(field.id)) {
                    fieldObj[field.id] = getTypedValue(gr, table, field);
                } else {
                    // number of fields that cannot be read for each record
                    if (fieldObj["protectedFields"] >= 1) {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"]++;
                    } else {
                        fieldObj["protectedFields"] = 1;
                    }
                }
            });
        } else {
            protectedRecords++;
        }
        results.push(fieldObj);
    }
    var recordCount = results.length;
    var total = recordCount + protectedRecords;
    var message = gs.getMessage("{0} out of {1} records returned from the {2} table.",
        [recordCount.toString(), total.toString(), tableName]);

    return {
        "records": results,
        "message": message,
        "status": "success"
    };
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-05 02:33:01</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>77d59f4783d032107f448287ceda1e7c</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Lookup ITIL User</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_77d59f4783d032107f448287ceda1e7c</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 02:50:34</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table/><type>crud</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Route Financial Analysis Agent</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-05 03:25:09">1bc12f07835432107f448287ceda1e89</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Route Financial Analysis Agent","role":"You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creator. Your role will be to calculate delay costs for each proposed route option, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger next agent.","background":"You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creation.

Set agent variable delivery_delay_sys_id = sys_id from the Delivery Delay lookup.
Set agent variable incident_sys_id = sys_id of the newly created Incident.



Do the following:

1) Query the Delivery Delay record using route_id.
2) Query the Supply Agreement record using customer_id.
3) Compute an agent variable named impact_json:
 - Parse proposed_routes (JSON array) from the Delivery Delay record.
 - For each route:
 hours = eta_minutes / 60 (and round up the answer to the next whole integer)
 delay_hours = max(hours - deliver_window_hours, 0)
 penalty = delay_hours * stockout_penalty_rate
 - Build this JSON object:
 {
 "customer_id": <int>,
 "deliver_window_hours": <int>,
 "stockout_penalty_rate": <int>,
 "routes": [
 { "option_id": "...", "route_number": ..., "eta_minutes": ...,"delay_hours": ..., "penalty": ... }
 ]
 }
 - Set impact_json to the stringified JSON above.

4) Create an Incident summarizing the problem and penalties.

AT THE END IMPORTANT!
5) Update the Delivery Delay record (matching by delivery_delay_sys_id) with:
 Place impact_json into the calculated_impact field
 - incident_sys_id = incident_sys_id
 - status = "calculated"","sys_id":"852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Calculate delay costs for route ID 47197, create incident records, and update delivery records if the Delivery Delay record status is pending.","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"scratchpad":[{"Thought":"The mission is to calculate delay costs for route ID 47197, create incident records, and update delivery records if the Delivery Delay record status is pending. Is it okay to proceed?","Observation":"{"records":[{"deliver_window_hours":"3","stockout_penalty_rate":"250","customer_name":"\"Whole Foods\""}],"message":"1 out of 1 records returned from the Supply Agreement table.","status":"success"}"},{"Thought":"The mission is to calculate delay costs for route ID 47197, create incident records, and update delivery records if the Delivery Delay record status is pending. sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Analyze financial impact of delivery disruptions and create incident tracking</description><instructions>You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creation.
Set agent variable delivery_delay_sys_id = sys_id from the Delivery Delay lookup. Set agent variable incident_sys_id = sys_id of the newly created Incident.
Do the following:
1) Query the Delivery Delay record using route_id. 2) Query the Supply Agreement record using customer_id. 3) Compute an agent variable named impact_json: - Parse proposed_routes (JSON array) from the Delivery Delay record. - For each route: hours = eta_minutes / 60 (and round up the answer to the next whole integer) delay_hours = max(hours - deliver_window_hours, 0) penalty = delay_hours * stockout_penalty_rate - Build this JSON object: { "customer_id": <int>, "deliver_window_hours": <int>, "stockout_penalty_rate": <int>, "routes": [ { "option_id": "...", "route_number": ..., "eta_minutes": ...,"delay_hours": ..., "penalty": ... } ] } - Set impact_json to the stringified JSON above.
4) Create an Incident summarizing the problem and penalties.
AT THE END IMPORTANT! 5) Update the Delivery Delay record (matching by delivery_delay_sys_id) with: Place impact_json into the calculated_impact field - incident_sys_id = incident_sys_id - status = "calculated"</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Financial Analysis Agent</internal_name><name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in financial analysis and incident record creation, enabling it to calculate delay costs for proposed route options, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger the next agent. - The agent follows a detailed ACTION PLAN to set variables, query Delivery Delay and Supply Agreement records, compute impact in JSON format, create incidents, and update records, ensuring a systematic approach to handling tasks. - The agent can utilize the 'Create Incident' tool to generate an incident record for delivery delays, using inputs such as route_id, truck_id, problem_description, and impact_json, ensuring comprehensive documentation of issues. - The agent effectively uses TOOL inputs like route_id, truck_id, problem_description, and impact_json to create detailed incident records, ensuring all relevant information is captured for each incident. - The agent combines querying Delivery Delay and Supply Agreement records, computing impact in JSON format, and updating records to manage delivery delays comprehensively, ensuring all steps from analysis to resolution are covered.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creator. Your role will be to calculate delay costs for each proposed route option, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger next agent.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-27 01:57:37</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03</sys_id><sys_mod_count>162</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 03:22:09</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_tool_49494628835432107f448287ceda1e43
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Update the Delivery Delay record with financial impact and sys_id</description><input_schema>[{"name":"delivery_delay_sys_id","description":""},{"name":"impact_json","description":""},{"name":"incident_sys_id","description":""},{"name":"crudInputs","description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</input_schema><name>Update Delivery Delay</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    // only string inputs are allowed 
    // return outputs object where the keys in it are understandable by LLM    
    // update script

    function getChoiceRecord(tableName, fieldName, value, queryType) {
        var choiceGr = new GlideRecordSecure("sys_choice");
        choiceGr.addQuery("name", tableName);
        choiceGr.addQuery("element", fieldName);
        choiceGr.addQuery(queryType, value);
        choiceGr.query();
        return choiceGr;
    }

    var table = inputs.crudInputs.table.value;
    var tableName = inputs.crudInputs.table.displayValue;
    // parses query expression containing {{variables}}
    function parseQuery(expression, inputs) {
        if (expression === "") return "";
        return expression.replace(/{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g, function(match, variableName) {
            if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                return inputs[variableName].toLowerCase();
            }
            return match;
        });
    }

    // parses {{value}} and obtains the correct value for a choice or reference field.
    function parseValue(value, field, inputs) {
        if (!value || typeof value === "object") return "";
        // regex to parse {{var}} and check if the inputs contain that prop
        var fieldValue = value.replace(
            /{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g,
            function(match, variableName) {
                if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                    return inputs[variableName];
                }
                return "";
            }
        );
        if (!fieldValue) return field.type === 'string' ? "" : null;
        if (field.type === "choice") {
            // search the choice table directly for the user inputted value first,
            // then search by the label.
            var choiceGr = getChoiceRecord(table, field.id, fieldValue, "value");
            if (choiceGr.getRowCount() === 1) {
                // The user input is already valid, set it directly.
                return fieldValue;
            }

            var choiceGr2 = getChoiceRecord(table, field.id, fieldValue, "label");
            if (choiceGr2.next()) {
                return choiceGr2.getValue("value");
            } else {
                gs.error(
                    gs.getMessage('[AIA AGENTS MSG] Invalid choice field value or label: {0}', fieldValue)
                );
            }
        } else if (field.referenceTable) {
            var refName = field.referenceTableDefaultField;
            var refGr = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGr.addQuery("sys_id", fieldValue);
            refGr.query();
            if (refGr.getRowCount() === 1) {
                // The user has inputted the sys_id directly.
                return fieldValue;
            }

            // search the reference table by its default field.
            var refGr2 = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGr2.addQuery(refName, fieldValue);
            refGr2.query();
            if (refGr2.next()) {
                return refGr2.getUniqueValue();
            } else {
                gs.error(
                    gs.getMessage('[AIA AGENTS MSG] Invalid reference field value or label: {0}', fieldValue)
                );
            }

        }
        return fieldValue;
    }

    var query = parseQuery(inputs.crudInputs.query, inputs);
    var fieldValues = inputs.crudInputs.fieldValues ? inputs.crudInputs.fieldValues : [];
    fieldValues = fieldValues.map(function(item) {
        var fieldValue = item.value ? item.value.fieldValue : "";
        return {
            field: item.field.id,
            value: parseValue(fieldValue, item.field, inputs)
        };
    });

    var gr = new GlideRecordSecure(table);
    var updatedRecords = [];
    var protectedRecords = 0;

    if (query) {
        gr.addEncodedQuery(query);
    }

    gr.query();
    while (gr.next()) {
        if (gr.canWrite()) {
            fieldValues.forEach(function(item) {
                if (gr.isValidField(item.field)) {
                    gr.setValue(item.field, item.value);
                }
            });
            gr.update();
            updatedRecords.push(gr.getValue('sys_id'));
        } else {
            protectedRecords++;
        }

    }
    var updated = updatedRecords.length;
    var total = updatedRecords.length + protectedRecords;
    var message = gs.getMessage("{0} out of {1} records updated in the {2} table.",
        [updated.toString(), total.toString(), tableName]);

    return {
        "updatedRecords": updatedRecords,
        "message": message,
        "status": "success"
    };
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-27 02:33:32</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>49494628835432107f448287ceda1e43</sys_id><sys_mod_count>15</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Update Delivery Delay</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_49494628835432107f448287ceda1e43</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 03:15:46</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table/><type>crud</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Select optimal routes and coordinate external execution</description><instructions>ROLE: Route decision agent.
APIs - Delivery Delay Lookup({ "sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"" }) fields: sys_id, route_id, truck_id, incident_sys_id, calculated_impact, proposed_routes. - Route Selection Tool({ "delivery_delay_sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"<route_id>", "best_option_id":"<option_id>" }). - Incident Priority Update({ "incident_sys_id":"<incident_sys_id>", "impact_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium">, "urgency_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium"> }). - Tool "n8n send" accepts exactly: { "route_id": "<route_id>" } and will fetch truck_id and chosen_option and POST to the n8n webhook.
RULES - Parse calculated_impact JSON. Choose the route with the lowest penalty; if tie, choose the lowest eta_minutes. - In proposed_routes find the matching option_id (fallback: route_number) to read distance_miles and eta_minutes. - Build ONE object (no newlines, no double-encoding): { "route_id":"<route_id>", "truck_id":"<truck_id>", "chosen_option":{ "option_id":"<best.option_id>", "route_number":<best.route_number>, "distance_miles":<match.distance_miles>, "eta_minutes":<match.eta_minutes> } } - Impact/Urgency rule: - if best.penalty <= 250 impact = "1 - High", urgency = "1 - High" - else impact = "1 - High", urgency = "2 - Medium"
ERRORS - If JSON parse fails: unescape once and retry. If still invalid, stop and report. - If no routes: output no eligible routes and stop. - If incident_sys_id missing or Incident Priority Update fails: stop and report.
ACTIONS 1) Call Delivery Delay Lookup using route_id (or sys_id if provided). 2) Select best route per RULES. 3) Call Route Selection Tool with: delivery_delay_sys_id = <sys_id> route_id = <route_id> best_option_id = <ONE-LINE JSON> // exactly the built JSON: {"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<n>,"distance_miles":<m>,"eta_minutes":<e>}
4) Update incident priority with Incident Priority Update using the Impact/Urgency rule. 5) Call tool "n8n send" with { "route_id": "<route_id>" }.
OUTPUT (exactly these keys, no code fences) lowest_route_line=Lowest route: option_id 'opt-X', route_number N, penalty P, eta_minutes E route_id=<route_id> webhook_payload={"route_id":"<route_id>","truck_id":"<truck_id>","chosen_option":{"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<num>,"distance_miles":<miles>,"eta_minutes":<mins>}} SHOW ME THE webhook_payload FROM THE STEP ABOVE</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Decision Agent</internal_name><name>Route Decision Agent</name><proficiency>- As a route decision agent, the primary capability is to evaluate and select optimal delivery routes by analyzing calculated financial data and incident priorities. This involves interpreting data to minimize penalties and ensure timely deliveries. - The agent can perform lookup operations using the Delivery Delay Lookup tool to gather data on delivery delays, including route IDs, truck IDs, and calculated impacts. This data is critical for assessing the best route options. - The agent utilizes the Route Selection Tool to select the best route by providing the delivery delay system ID, route ID, and the best option ID. This ensures that the chosen route aligns with the lowest penalty and optimal ETA. - The agent can update incident priorities using the Incident Priority Update tool, applying rules to determine the impact and urgency based on the best route's penalty score. This ensures that high-priority incidents are addressed promptly. - The agent can send the constructed JSON payload to the n8n webhook using the n8n send tool, facilitating the integration of route decisions with external workflows and systems. - The agent is capable of executing a complete workflow by combining the Delivery Delay Lookup, Route Selection Tool, Incident Priority Update, and n8n send tools. This integrated approach ensures efficient route decision-making and implementation.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are a route decision agent, you will need to record lookup operations for calculated financial data, route selection and update operations, use incident priority management tools and webhook or script tools for n8n integration.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-27 22:56:52</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>3aa0ee7c831032107f448287ceda1e1f</sys_id><sys_mod_count>126</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Decision Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_3aa0ee7c831032107f448287ceda1e1f</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-01 21:22:34</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Route Financial Analysis Agent</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-05 03:47:06">89d62743839432107f448287ceda1e97</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Route Financial Analysis Agent","role":"You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creator. Your role will be to calculate delay costs for each proposed route option, create incident records, update delivery records, and progress workflow to trigger next agent.","background":"You are an expert in financial analysis and incident record creation.

Set agent variable delivery_delay_sys_id = sys_id from the Delivery Delay lookup.
Set agent variable incident_sys_id = sys_id of the newly created Incident.



Do the following:

1) Query the Delivery Delay record using route_id.
2) Query the Supply Agreement record using customer_id.
3) Compute an agent variable named impact_json:
 - Parse proposed_routes (JSON array) from the Delivery Delay record.
 - For each route:
 hours = eta_minutes / 60 (and round up the answer to the next whole integer)
 delay_hours = max(hours - deliver_window_hours, 0)
 penalty = delay_hours * stockout_penalty_rate
 - Build this JSON object:
 {
 "customer_id": <int>,
 "deliver_window_hours": <int>,
 "stockout_penalty_rate": <int>,
 "routes": [
 { "option_id": "...", "route_number": ..., "eta_minutes": ...,"delay_hours": ..., "penalty": ... }
 ]
 }
 - Set impact_json to the stringified JSON above.

4) Create an Incident summarizing the problem and penalties.

AT THE END IMPORTANT!
5) Update the Delivery Delay record (matching by delivery_delay_sys_id) with:
 Place impact_json into the calculated_impact field
 - incident_sys_id = incident_sys_id
 - status = "calculated"","sys_id":"852f7120831432107f448287ceda1e03","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Calculate delay costs for route ID 999198, create incident records, and update delivery records to progress the workflow.","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"scratchpad":[{"Thought":"The mission is to calculate delay costs for route ID 999198, create incident records, and update delivery records to progress the workflow. <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Route Decision Agent</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-05 03:47:06">89d62743839432107f448287ceda1e97</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Route Decision Agent","role":"You are a route decision agent, you will need to record lookup operations for calculated financial data, route selection and update operations, use incident priority management tools and webhook or script tools for n8n integration.","background":"ROLE: Route decision agent.

APIs
- Delivery Delay Lookup({ "sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"" }) fields: sys_id, route_id, truck_id, incident_sys_id, calculated_impact, proposed_routes.
- Route Selection Tool({ "delivery_delay_sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"<route_id>", "best_option_id":"<option_id>" }).
- Incident Priority Update({ "incident_sys_id":"<incident_sys_id>", "impact_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium">, "urgency_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium"> }).
- Tool "n8n send" accepts exactly: { "route_id": "<route_id>" } and will fetch truck_id and chosen_option and POST to the n8n webhook.

RULES
- Parse calculated_impact JSON. Choose the route with the lowest penalty; if tie, choose the lowest eta_minutes.
- In proposed_routes find the matching option_id (fallback: route_number) to read distance_miles and eta_minutes.
- Build ONE object (no newlines, no double-encoding):
 {
 "route_id":"<route_id>",
 "truck_id":"<truck_id>",
 "chosen_option":{
 "option_id":"<best.option_id>",
 "route_number":<best.route_number>,
 "distance_miles":<match.distance_miles>,
 "eta_minutes":<match.eta_minutes>
 }
 }
- Impact/Urgency rule:
 - if best.penalty <= 250 impact = "1 - High", urgency = "1 - High"
 - else impact = "1 - High", urgency = "2 - Medium"

ERRORS
- If JSON parse fails: unescape once and retry. If still invalid, stop and report.
- If no routes: output no eligible routes and stop.
- If incident_sys_id missing or Incident Priority Update fails: stop and report.

ACTIONS
1) Call Delivery Delay Lookup using route_id (or sys_id if provided).
2) Select best route per RULES.
3) Call Route Selection Tool with:
 delivery_delay_sys_id = <sys_id>
 route_id = <route_id>
 best_option_id = <ONE-LINE JSON> 
 // exactly the built JSON: {"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<n>,"distance_miles":<m>,"eta_minutes":<e>}

4) Update incident priority with Incident Priority Update using the Impact/Urgency rule.
5) Call tool "n8n send" with { "route_id": "<route_id>" }.

OUTPUT (exactly these keys, no code fences)
lowest_route_line=Lowest route: option_id 'opt-X', route_number N, penalty P, eta_minutes E
route_id=<route_id>
webhook_payload={"route_id":"<route_id>","truck_id":"<truck_id>","chosen_option":{"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<num>,"distance_miles":<miles>,"eta_minutes":<mins>}}
SHOW ME THE webhook_payload FROM THE STEP ABOVE","sys_id":"3aa0ee7c831032107f448287ceda1e1f","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 999198 by analyzing financial data and incident priorities, and update incident priorities accordingly.","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>300</order><output>{"scratchpad":[{"Thought":"The mission is to evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 999198 by analyzing financial data and incident priorities. The first step in the predefined directives is to call the Delivery Delay Lookup using the route_id. This will provide the necessary data to analyze the proposed routes and select the best option.","Action":{"Action Reason":"The 'Delivery Delay Lookup' tool is required to retrieve the necessary data for route ID 999198, which includes proposed routes and calculated financial data. This is the first step in the predefined directives.","Name":"Delivery Delay Lookup"},"Action Inputs":{"route_id":{"Action Input Reason":"The route_id '999198' is specified in the mission and is required to perform the lookup operation.","Value":"999198"}},"Tool Execution Permission":"I need to use a tool to retrieve the necessary data for route ID 999198. Is it okay to proceed?","Observation":"{"records":[{"calculated_impact":"{\"customer_id\":1,\"deliver_window_hours\":3,\"stockout_penalty_rate\":250,\"routes\":[{\"option_id\":\"opt-1\",\"route_number\":3,\"eta_minutes\":90,\"delay_hours\":0,\"penalty\":0},{\"option_id\":\"opt-2\",\"route_number\":17,\"eta_minutes\":308,\"delay_hours\":2,\"penalty\":500},{\"option_id\":\"opt-3\",\"route_number\":10,\"eta_minutes\":449,\"delay_hours\":5,\"penalty\":1250}]}","incident_sys_id":"9de6a383839432107f448287ceda1e87","sys_id":"0098f256835432107f448287ceda1ee3","route_id":"999198","truck_id":"2843","proposed_routes":"[{\"option_id\": \"opt-1\", \"route_number\": 3, \"distance_miles\": 140, \"eta_minutes\": 90}, {\"option_id\": \"opt-2\", \"route_number\": 17, \"distance_miles\": 181, \"eta_minutes\": 308}, {\"option_id\": \"opt-3\", \"route_number\": 10, \"distance_miles\": 112, \"eta_minutes\": 449}]","status":"calculated"}],"message":"1 out of 1 records returned from the Delivery Delay table.","status":"success"}"},{"Thought":"The mission is to evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 999198 by analyzing financial data and incident priorities. <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_tool"><sn_aia_tool action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><active>true</active><description>Create an incident record for delivery delay</description><input_schema>[{"name":"route_id","description":""},{"name":"truck_id","description":""},{"name":"problem_description","description":""},{"name":"impact_json","description":""},{"name":"crudInputs","description":"CRUD Input Variables. These are already pre-defined. Under no circumstances should you prompt the user for this information or attempt to change these values."}]</input_schema><name>Create Incident</name><record_type>custom</record_type><script><![CDATA[(function(inputs) {
    // only string inputs are allowed 
    // return outputs object where the keys in it are understandable by LLM.   
    // create script
    function getChoiceRecord(tableName, fieldName, value, queryType) {
        var choiceGr = new GlideRecordSecure("sys_choice");
        choiceGr.addQuery("name", tableName);
        choiceGr.addQuery("element", fieldName);
        choiceGr.addQuery(queryType, value);
        choiceGr.query();
        return choiceGr;
    }

    var table = inputs.crudInputs.table.value;
    var tableName = inputs.crudInputs.table.displayValue;
    var fieldValues = inputs.crudInputs.fieldValues ?
        inputs.crudInputs.fieldValues :
        [];

    // parses {{value}} and obtains the correct value for a choice or reference field.
    function parseValue(value, field, inputs) {
        if (!value || typeof value === "object") return "";
        // regex to parse {{var}} and check if the inputs contains that prop
        var fieldValue = value.replace(
            /{{\s*(\w+)\s*}}/g,
            function(match, variableName) {
                if (inputs && inputs.hasOwnProperty(variableName)) {
                    return inputs[variableName];
                }
                return "";
            }
        );
        if (!fieldValue) return field.type === 'string' ? "" : null;
        if (field.type === "choice") {
            // search the choice table directly for the user inputted value first,
            // then search by the label.
            var choiceGr = getChoiceRecord(table, field.id, fieldValue, "value");
            if (choiceGr.getRowCount() === 1) {
                // The user input is already valid, set it directly.
                return fieldValue;
            }

            var choiceGr2 = getChoiceRecord(table, field.id, fieldValue, "label");
            if (choiceGr2.next()) {
                return choiceGr2.getValue("value");
            } else {
                gs.error(
                    gs.getMessage('[AIA AGENTS MSG] Invalid choice field value or label: {0}', fieldValue)
                );
            }
        } else if (field.referenceTable) {
            var refName = field.referenceTableDefaultField;
            var refGr = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGr.addQuery("sys_id", fieldValue);
            refGr.query();
            if (refGr.getRowCount() === 1) {
                // The user has inputted the sys_id directly.
                return fieldValue;
            }

            // search the reference table by its default field.
            var refGr2 = new GlideRecordSecure(field.referenceTable);
            refGr2.addQuery(refName, fieldValue);
            refGr2.query();
            if (refGr2.next()) {
                return refGr2.getUniqueValue();
            } else {
                gs.error(
                    gs.getMessage('[AIA AGENTS MSG] Invalid reference field value or label: {0}', fieldValue)
                );
            }

        }
        return fieldValue;
    }

    // each field is passed as an {id, label} obj to be displayed when editing the tool
    // each value is not passed directly, but in an object containing the fieldValue prop
    fieldValues = fieldValues.map(function(item) {
        var fieldValue = item.value ? item.value.fieldValue : "";
        return {
            field: item.field.id,
            value: parseValue(fieldValue, item.field, inputs),
        };
    });

    var gr = new GlideRecordSecure(table);
    if (gr.canCreate()) {
        gr.initialize();
        fieldValues.forEach(function(item) {
            if (gr.isValidField(item.field)) {
                gr.setValue(item.field, item.value);
            }
        });
    } else {
        return {
            output: gs.getMessage(
                "Cannot create record due to security constraints."
            ),
        };
    }
    var sysId = gr.insert();

    if (!sysId) {
        gs.error(gs.getMessage("[AIA AGENTS MSG] Failed to insert the record."));
        return {
            output: gs.getMessage("Failed to insert the record")
        };
    }
    return {
        sysId: sysId,
        message: gs.getMessage("Record successfully inserted into the {0} table.", [tableName]),
        status: "success"
    };
})(inputs);]]></script><sys_class_name>sn_aia_tool</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-27 02:33:32</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>0d490e24835432107f448287ceda1e8a</sys_id><sys_mod_count>15</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Create Incident</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">d1e861e8831032107f448287ceda1eea</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_tool_0d490e24835432107f448287ceda1e8a</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-05 03:15:46</sys_updated_on><target_document/><target_document_table>undefined</target_document_table><type>crud</type></sn_aia_tool></record_update>

sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Route Decision Agent</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-10-05 03:25:09">1bc12f07835432107f448287ceda1e89</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"Route Decision Agent","role":"You are a route decision agent, you will need to record lookup operations for calculated financial data, route selection and update operations, use incident priority management tools and webhook or script tools for n8n integration.","background":"ROLE: Route decision agent.

APIs
- Delivery Delay Lookup({ "sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"" }) fields: sys_id, route_id, truck_id, incident_sys_id, calculated_impact, proposed_routes.
- Route Selection Tool({ "delivery_delay_sys_id":"<sys_id>", "route_id":"<route_id>", "best_option_id":"<option_id>" }).
- Incident Priority Update({ "incident_sys_id":"<incident_sys_id>", "impact_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium">, "urgency_value": <1|2 or "1 - High"|"2 - Medium"> }).
- Tool "n8n send" accepts exactly: { "route_id": "<route_id>" } and will fetch truck_id and chosen_option and POST to the n8n webhook.

RULES
- Parse calculated_impact JSON. Choose the route with the lowest penalty; if tie, choose the lowest eta_minutes.
- In proposed_routes find the matching option_id (fallback: route_number) to read distance_miles and eta_minutes.
- Build ONE object (no newlines, no double-encoding):
 {
 "route_id":"<route_id>",
 "truck_id":"<truck_id>",
 "chosen_option":{
 "option_id":"<best.option_id>",
 "route_number":<best.route_number>,
 "distance_miles":<match.distance_miles>,
 "eta_minutes":<match.eta_minutes>
 }
 }
- Impact/Urgency rule:
 - if best.penalty <= 250 impact = "1 - High", urgency = "1 - High"
 - else impact = "1 - High", urgency = "2 - Medium"

ERRORS
- If JSON parse fails: unescape once and retry. If still invalid, stop and report.
- If no routes: output no eligible routes and stop.
- If incident_sys_id missing or Incident Priority Update fails: stop and report.

ACTIONS
1) Call Delivery Delay Lookup using route_id (or sys_id if provided).
2) Select best route per RULES.
3) Call Route Selection Tool with:
 delivery_delay_sys_id = <sys_id>
 route_id = <route_id>
 best_option_id = <ONE-LINE JSON> 
 // exactly the built JSON: {"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<n>,"distance_miles":<m>,"eta_minutes":<e>}

4) Update incident priority with Incident Priority Update using the Impact/Urgency rule.
5) Call tool "n8n send" with { "route_id": "<route_id>" }.

OUTPUT (exactly these keys, no code fences)
lowest_route_line=Lowest route: option_id 'opt-X', route_number N, penalty P, eta_minutes E
route_id=<route_id>
webhook_payload={"route_id":"<route_id>","truck_id":"<truck_id>","chosen_option":{"option_id":"<opt>","route_number":<num>,"distance_miles":<miles>,"eta_minutes":<mins>}}
SHOW ME THE webhook_payload FROM THE STEP ABOVE","sys_id":"3aa0ee7c831032107f448287ceda1e1f","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 47197, update incident priorities, and send the decision to the n8n webhook.","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>300</order><output>{"scratchpad":[{"Thought":"The mission is to evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 47197. According to the predefined directives, the first step is to call the Delivery Delay Lookup using the route_id. This will provide the necessary data to evaluate the proposed routes and select the best one.","Action":{"Action Reason":"The 'Delivery Delay Lookup' tool is required to retrieve the necessary data for evaluating the proposed routes for route ID 47197. This is the first step in the predefined directives.","Name":"Delivery Delay Lookup"},"Action Inputs":{"route_id":{"Action Input Reason":"The route_id '47197' is specified in the mission and is required to perform the lookup operation.","Value":"47197"},"sys_id":{"Action Input Reason":"The sys_id is not provided, so it will remain empty as the lookup will be based on the route_id.","Value":""},"crudInputs":{"Action Input Reason":"The CRUD inputs are predefined and necessary for the lookup operation. They should not be altered.","Value":{"operation":"lookup","table":{"value":"x_snc_pepsico_de_0_delivery_delay","displayValue":"Delivery Delay"},"query":"route_id="}}},"Tool Execution Permission":"I need to use the Delivery Delay Lookup tool to retrieve data for evaluating the proposed routes for route ID 47197. Is it okay to proceed?","Observation":"{"records":[{"calculated_impact":"{\"customer_id\":1,\"deliver_window_hours\":3,\"stockout_penalty_rate\":250,\"routes\":[{\"option_id\":\"opt-1\",\"route_number\":1,\"eta_minutes\":496,\"delay_hours\":5,\"penalty\":1250},{\"option_id\":\"opt-2\",\"route_number\":7,\"eta_minutes\":475,\"delay_hours\":5,\"penalty\":1250},{\"option_id\":\"opt-3\",\"route_number\":11,\"eta_minutes\":99,\"delay_hours\":0,\"penalty\":0}]}","incident_sys_id":"9fd16f47835432107f448287ceda1e15","sys_id":"018a86e8835432107f448287ceda1ea6","route_id":"47197","truck_id":"4714","proposed_routes":"[{\"option_id\": \"opt-1\", \"route_number\": 1, \"distance_miles\": 103, \"eta_minutes\": 496}, {\"option_id\": \"opt-2\", \"route_number\": 7, \"distance_miles\": 156, \"eta_minutes\": 475}, {\"option_id\": \"opt-3\", \"route_number\": 11, \"distance_miles\": 173, \"eta_minutes\": 99}]","status":"calculated"}],"message":"1 out of 1 records returned from the Delivery Delay table.","status":"success"}"},{"Thought":"The mission is to evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 47197. This is the next step in the predefined directives.","Name":"retrieve_and_generate_factual_data"},"Action Inputs":{},"Observation":"The best route has been determined: option_id 'opt-3', route_number 11, penalty 0, eta_minutes 99."},{"Thought":"The mission is to evaluate and select the optimal delivery route for route ID 47197.
